SMW Subobject for (p+)High Alchemy value: 37440Buy limit: 70Examine: A poison-tipped, one-handed dragon hasta.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Dragon hastaImage: File:Dragon hasta(p+).pngUses infobox: ItemWeight: 2.267Value: 62400Version anchor: Poison+Release date: 10 January 2019Item ID: 22737

The dragon hasta is a one-handed, melee members weapon that requires 60 Attack and Barbarian Training in Smithing to be wielded. It can also be poisoned, just like spears.

Dragon hastae are obtained as loot from the brimstone chest, which requires a brimstone key to open. Brimstone keys are obtained as drops by killing any monsters under an assignment of Konar. The dragon hasta is always broken upon obtainment from the chest and can be repaired, for free, by simply showing it to Otto Godblessed (Barbarian smithing is NOT required either - it's only required for wielding purposes).

Although hastae offer negative defensive bonuses, using them along with a shield will provide players with more defence bonuses than simply using the spear version.

Special attack[edit | edit source]

A player performs the dragon hasta's special attack, Unleash.

The dragon hasta has a special attack called Unleash, which causes the next attack to have a 5% boost in accuracy and a 2.5% boost in damage for every 5% of special attack energy used.

For example, a player with 100% special attack energy who performs the special attack will cause their next attack to have 100% increased accuracy (meaning the accuracy is doubled) and a damage boost of 50%.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
7 July 2021
(update)

The position of the weapon and its variants on female players has been adjusted so that they appear to be equipped properly.

14 February 2019
(update)

The examine text was changed. Previously, the text was "A poison-tipped, one-handed dragon hasta."

24 January 2019
(update)

The Karambwan poison variant is no longer tradeable. Noted variants of the dragon hasta(kp) that remain in the player's possession were converted into the item Fake dragon hasta(kp).

17 January 2019
(update)

Item value decreased from 100,000 to 62,400 coins.

14 January 2019
(update) 		Hotfix

The Dragon hasta no longer deals full damage to the Corporeal Beast. [1]

  1. Jagex. Old School RuneScape's Twitter account. 14 January 2019. (Archived from the original on 25 May 2020.)

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The special attack animation of the dragon hasta is the same as that of the dragon sword, sharing the same red glow rather than the entire hasta being covered in it.
  • Before an update, the broken dragon hasta had a higher value than the fixed dragon hasta.
  • As of 2019 January, since Dragon hasta(kp) is no longer a noteable item, any previously noted Dragon hasta(kp) were converted into the item Fake dragon hasta(kp).

The '''dragon hasta''' is a one-handed, [[melee]] [[members]] [[weapon]] that requires 60 [[Attack]] and [[Barbarian Training]] in [[Smithing]] to be wielded. It can also be [[poison]]ed, just like spears.

Dragon hastae are obtained as loot from the [[brimstone chest]], which requires a [[brimstone key]] to open. Brimstone keys are obtained as drops by killing any monsters under an assignment of [[Konar]]. The dragon hasta is always [[Broken dragon hasta|broken]] upon obtainment from the chest and can be repaired, for free, by simply showing it to [[Otto Godblessed]] (Barbarian smithing is NOT required either - it's only required for wielding purposes).

Although hastae offer negative defensive bonuses, using them along with a [[shield]] will provide players with more defence bonuses than simply using the spear version.

==Special attack==
[[File:Unleash.gif|frame|A player performs the dragon hasta's special attack, ''Unleash''.]]
The dragon hasta has a [[special attack]] called ''Unleash'', which causes the next attack to have a 5% boost in accuracy and a 2.5% boost in damage for every 5% of special attack energy used.

For example, a player with 100% special attack energy who performs the special attack will cause their next attack to have 100% increased accuracy (meaning the accuracy is doubled) and a damage boost of 50%.
